intro: Lastrea microbasis, commonly known as the small-leaved lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
